bibl.title: Ray Raymond v. Territory of Washington. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Spokane} ss

I do hereby return to the Honorable Judge George Turner Judge of the Fourth Judicial District Holding Terms at Spokane Falls Washington Territory that before the coming to one of the within writ the said Joseph Bradshaw was committed to my custody and is detained by writ of a commitment. A copy of which I failed to bring with me. Nevertheless, I have the body of the said Joseph Bradshaw before you at the time and place within metion. As I am within commanded

S.J. Packwood
Sheriff of Kittitas Co W.T.

Conveying prisoner from Ellensburg W.T. To Spokane Falls, W.T. and Return to Ellensburg W.T. To Sheriffs per diem 15 days 3 at nine per day 45.00 Convey Ellensburg to Spokane Falls 271 mi at mile 10 27.10 Spokane Falls to Ellensburg W.T. 271 mi .10 27.10 4 days Board for prisoner $1.00 per day 4.00 " mileage on Prisoner 542 miles 10 per mile 54.20 $157.40
Territory of Washington, County of Spokane} ss

F.W. Shaser being duly sworn, deposes and says that he is Deputy Sheriff Kittitas County W.T., that the above and foregoing account is hereby correct, and the services therein charged were actually and necessarily performed.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this first day of June 1887

figure.p: DISTRICT COURT WASHINGTON TERRITORY FOURTH JUD. DISTRICT SPOKANE COUNTY

div1.p: In the District Court 4th Judicial District, holding terms at Cheney, Spokane Falls.
Writ of Habeas Corpus Filed in the office of the Clerk of the District Court this day of 188
